title: Development and Utilization of Open-Source Mathematics Educational Resources

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Focused on developing and sharing open-source math education resources optimized for smartphone-based mobile environments for learners over 40, requiring learning design considerations for limited-technology settings (no PC access)

learning_goals: Learners can produce visualization materials for basic math concepts using open-source educational resource development tools (e.g., GeoGebra, Moodle).
Learners can collaboratively develop open-source educational content suitable for mobile environments and share it on platforms such as GitHub.
Through project-based assessment, learners can apply collaboratively developed math educational resources to real-world teaching scenarios.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
